content.description: Very short climb suitable for first time climbers. A nice little crack on a relaxed slope. As you would expect for the rating, there are always holds within easy reach, but some of them are small enough to make nonclimbers worry and sweat. People with any climbing experience at all should have no trouble.
content.protection: Three bolts at the top. They are easily reached by hiking around the wall then following the path until you see them.
content.location: On the right of Kindergarten Cliff, nearer to the textbooks than to the reproductive wall.

content.description: In the middle of the student wall, between the reproductive wall and the textbooks, the ground rises up to make the cliff only about 20 feet high. I found two top rope anchors above easy routes, but for the rest of the wall you'll have to find another way to protect if you want to climb there. Reasonable to bring first time climbers to set up short top ropes for them, but otherwise not much reason to spend time here.
